marklogic.body: Ugh, they brought Doyle's voice back. You guys, I was starting to move on a little. I went a whole comment (sort of) without mentioning Doyle and then this. Why?????????????? I'll flap right along with you, Angel. I miss him. A lot. I still have a Doyle-shaped hole in my heart, although Wesley has managed to make it stop Bleeding. But why would you do this to me? Once again, I was convinced we'd see Doyle, standing in the binding circle. I know that makes no sense, only voices were borrowed, but that's what I thought would happen. Gotta shake this ...okay, other things happened in this episode besides missing Doyle. What? Oh yeah, kid being possessed by a demon who couldn't escape the kid. But, fun fact, Lizzie Borden was acquitted. I love Wesley. If Joss kills him or ruins his life to a ridiculous degree, I will never forgive Whedon. (It's Always Whedon's fault.) And the friendships on this show are beautiful. And Angel was positively monochromatic in this episode. Black is so classic.
